snippet.textDisplay: I'm talking about if you play it on a computer, sitting there with your small screen and keyboard trying to play a game is bound to rip the experience from you. snippet.textDisplay: You know that feeling you have when a franchise you love has gone past its heyday and its last game simply didn't cut it?  As much as I disagree with the Other M haters, I really do have to feel that way when I see Samus in Lower Norfair, standing on those jumbled columns.
snippet.textOriginal: You know that feeling you have when a franchise you love has gone past its heyday and its last game simply didn't cut it?  As much as I disagree with the Other M haters, I really do have to feel that way when I see Samus in Lower Norfair, standing on those jumbled columns.

snippet.textDisplay: @MrEpicTruth Sigh, I wouldn't say it was that awful, but the terrible dialogue and story was so bad... I tried to give it a chance and it failed in that aspect, it was also incredibly short and quite linear for a Metroid game although perhaps the less time it went on for the better. Otherwise the gameplay was good, surprised at how well the controls worked, and of course it was graphically sound. I especially enjoyed the 'extra' boss!
snippet.textOriginal: @MrEpicTruth Sigh, I wouldn't say it was that awful, but the terrible dialogue and story was so bad... I tried to give it a chance and it failed in that aspect, it was also incredibly short and quite linear for a Metroid game although perhaps the less time it went on for the better. Otherwise the gameplay was good, surprised at how well the controls worked, and of course it was graphically sound. I especially enjoyed the 'extra' boss!

snippet.textDisplay: Back when I was a kid I would always ask my dad to play and I would watch him play this game. When he would make it to the final boss (whom everyone knows by now surely) I would be too scared to stay in the room. I miss the good ol days where games weren't just about graphics. Also I never really cared for the music back then just how fun the game was. Now I enjoy the music and never really noticed how underrated this one is.
snippet.textOriginal: Back when I was a kid I would always ask my dad to play and I would watch him play this game. When he would make it to the final boss (whom everyone knows by now surely) I would be too scared to stay in the room. I miss the good ol days where games weren't just about graphics. Also I never really cared for the music back then just how fun the game was. Now I enjoy the music and never really noticed how underrated this one is.

snippet.textDisplay: Sadly, I wasn't video game savvy enough to experience the real SNES games as a 4-5 year-old but I did make one of the best finds ever... A Link To The Past. snippet.textDisplay:
Yes, a forbidding atmosphere of methane and ammonia.  Possibly with some kind of microscopic airborne parasites as well.

Super Metroid is the greatest.
snippet.textOriginal:
Yes, a forbidding atmosphere of methane and ammonia.  Possibly with some kind of microscopic airborne parasites as well.

Super Metroid is the greatest.

snippet.textDisplay: I love this kind of music.  It just makes you feel cool and dangerous when you're playing, and it fits the slick/alien/sci-fi feel of Samus and the environment like a glove.  It manages to turn the gameplay into storytelling, not just action.
snippet.textOriginal: I love this kind of music.  It just makes you feel cool and dangerous when you're playing, and it fits the slick/alien/sci-fi feel of Samus and the environment like a glove.  It manages to turn the gameplay into storytelling, not just action.
